definition: elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent

sentences.english: Man, you have been walking on air for days.
sentences.chinese: 夥計，你最近這幾天都一副飄飄然的樣子。

sentences.english: I think he's secretly revelling in all the attention.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得他對於能夠引起廣泛的注意心裏感到飄飄然。

sentences.english: Says Mr. Goldsmith: 'Strong leaders don't coast.'
sentences.chinese: 戈德史密斯說，強有力的領導人不會飄飄然。

sentences.english: The girl's head turned with a handful of compliments.
sentences.chinese: 幾句恭維話讓這個女孩飄飄然。

sentences.english: One day I heard my teacher praising me to my mother.
sentences.chinese: 有一天我聽見老師向我媽媽表揚我，感覺飄飄然。

sentences.english: I had nothing to eat for two days; I floated into work.
sentences.chinese: 接連兩天我什麼都沒喫，飄飄然去上工。

sentences.english: He just breezed in and sat down, without even apologizing.
sentences.chinese: 他飄飄然地走進來坐下，連道歉都不說一聲。

definition: lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
